name: Egg muffin
description: An exciting new way to eat eggs. Great for breakfasts or simple lunches. This recipe yields 1 serving.
instructions: Whisk eggs
Spray the muffin tray with oil
Pour egg mixture into muffin tray
Cut up ham into small pieces and put into the muffin tray with the eggs
Put chopped up spinach into muffin tray with the eggs
Top with cheese
Preheat the oven to 350F
Cook for 20 mins
Take it out of the tray and enjoy!

name: Hummus without tahini
description: A simple hummus recipe that is easy to make when you don't have any tahini.
ingredients: 1 15.5oz can of chickpeas/garbanzo beans, drained and liquid reserved
instructions: Drain chickpeas and reserve liquid for later use.
Add all ingredients, except paprika, to food processor and process until smooth.
Transfer hummus to dish and sprinkle with paprika. Eat with veggies or chips and enjoy!

name: Morning Glory Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 12 muffin cups or grease non-stick muffin pan. I filled almost 2 dozen muffin pans.
In a large bowl, mix together dry ingredients. Stir in carrots, raisins, chopped walnuts, coconut, shredded apple, and flaxseed. Mix until well blended.
In a separate smaller bowl, whisk together the eggs, oil and vanilla. Pour the egg mixture into the carrot/flour mixture and stir just until moistened.
Scoop batter into prepared muffin cups.
Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 min. they will be done when the centers are still slightly soft but a toothpick inserted into the center of the muffin comes out clean.

name: Apple Sausage Butternut Squash
description: This is all sorts of deliciousness in one easy recipe filled with flavors.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celcius)
Peel the butternut squash, cut it in 1 inch cubes, lightly oil them, sprinkle with salt and pepper and bake them for 25 mins
While the butternut squash is cooking, add the sausage to a saute pan on medium heat. Use a spatula to break up the sausage and cook until it's just browned
Add the onions, garlic and baby spinach to the pan and stir for 2-3 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted
Add the apple, sage and rosemary and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the apple has softened slightly
Turn off the heat and stir in the cranberries and pecans. Mix in the baked butternut squash cubes

name: Zucchini Bread
description: A very healthy homemade recipe for when you have too many zucchinis in your kitchen!
ingredients: 1.5 cup shredded zucchini, (1 large or 2 small zucchini)
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 Fahrenheit
Grease a 9-inch loaf pan with coconut oil, butter or cooking spray
Grate zucchini on the small holes of a box grater. Set aside
In a large bowl, combine white whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and coconut sugar

In a medium bowl, combine eggs, coconut oil, unsweetened almond milk, and vanilla extract. Whisk together and then pour the wet ingredients into the dry and stir until everything is just combined and you have a nice thick batter
Add the zucchini and walnuts to the batter and mix until evenly distributed
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan and top with extra walnuts (if desired!)
Bake for 50 minutes or until set through and a toothpick comes out clean

name: Coconut Chicken Curry
description: Have an occasional Indian dish for a change!
instructions: In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat
Add the chicken to the skillet and season it with salt and pepepr to taste
Cook the chicken, stirring occasionally, until it begins to brown
Add the red bell pepper, onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook, stirring, until the mixture becomes fragrant
Stir in the curry paste and curry powder and cook, stirring, until they become fragrant
Add the coconut milk and brown sugar. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the sauce reduces and begins to thicken
Turn off the heat. Stir in the lime zest and juice
Serve immediately topped with the cilantro and a side of garlic butter bread

name: Cauliflower Fried Rice
description: Low-carb recipe for a quick and easy weeknight meal!
ingredients: 4 scallions sliced, with white and green parts separated
instructions: Cut the cauliflower into smaller pieces and place them in the Vitamix (No more than 2/3 full). Fill with water just until the cauliflower lifts above the blade. Pulse until desired consistency is reached, about 6-8 times.
Pour the mixture through a sieve and pat the cauliflower dry.

Heat the sesame oil in a large wok or skillet on medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger and sauté for 20 seconds, then stir in the onions, carrots and white parts of the scallions and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the cauliflower rice and peas to the wok and stir together for another 2-3 minutes.
Create a well in the middle of the cauliflower rice and break the eggs into the well. Use your spatula to stir and scramble the eggs. Once the eggs are cooked, stir everything together.
Add the soy sauce and green parts of the scallions and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

name: Healthy Turkey and Egg Casserole
description: This casserole is filled with turkey, spinach and artichoke. It’s perfect for holidays, family gatherings or meal prep.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit.
Heat the oil in a sauté pan on medium heat. Add the onion and bell pepper and give it a quick stir. Add the ground turkey and use a large spoon to break up the turkey.
Add the spices, salt and pepper and stir to combine everything. Cook until there's no liquid in the pan and the meat is cooked through and browned.
Add the spinach to the meat mixture and stir for 1-2 minutes or until the spinach just starts to wilt.
Transfer the meat to a 9x13-inch casserole dish and evenly cover the bottom. Top with the artichoke hearts and beaten eggs.
Optional: you can add some cheese at this stage.
Sprinkle the green onion on top.
Cook the casserole in the oven for 40-45 minutes, or until cooked through.
Before serving, garnish with parmesan cheese (optional) and an extra sprinkle of pepper.
